To the Editor-in-Chief,
Johns Hopkins News-Letter.
Dear Sir:
There has been some complaint
about the meager supply of chess
and checkers kept by the 'Y' office. Although the reading room
equipment is within the jurisdicseems to - be an

unnecessary

the room and out of the windows.
The students have been requested to return the games to
the 'Y' office after playing. • This
request has. been usually disregarded. Consequently the supply has diminished so that out of
twelve complete sets of checkers,
and six of chess,...but one set of
chess and scarcely one of checkers are no.w available.
The `Y' has ordered another
supply of games; but these- will
go as the original ones did, if the
students do not use some discretion, and exercise some regard
for others' rights; —
The edition of "Life" for
March 8 and the cover for it
have been missng from the room
for a week. The magaznes. can
hardly be used by all if they be
monopolized by anyone person.
With some consideration and
co-operation on the students'
part, the reading robin will be
supplied with games and magazines.
Your support is requested.
Respectfully,
V. J. WYCKOFF,
